description: From French insectivore. In the zoological sense, coined by William Whewell in 1840 as an adaptation of Cuvier's coinage, French insectivore. The French terms reflect scientific New Latin origins; surface analysis, insect +‎ -i- +‎ -vore.

examples: An anteater is an insectivore with a long sticky tongue to catch its prey.

entries.meaning: (zoology, dated) mammal of the now abandoned order Insectivora.
